data.question: What is the empirical formula of bio-MOF-11?
What method was used for the synthesis of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: Solvothermal reaction between cobalt acetate tetrahydrate and adenine in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF).

data.question: What is the maximum CO2 uptake capacity of bio-MOF-11 at 273 K?
Is the CO2 adsorption isotherm of bio-MOF-11 at 273 K completely reversible?
What is the CO2/N2 selectivity of bio-MOF-11 at 273 K?
What is the role of adenine in the structure of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: Adenine acts as a biomolecular building block that enables the construction of a topologically diverse family of materials with high CO2 adsorption energies.

data.question: Does bio-MOF-11 exhibit higher CO2 capacities and selectivities over N2 compared to other amine-functionalized MOFs?
What is the estimated Brunauer−Emmett−Teller (BET) surface area of bio-MOF-11?
How was the permanent porosity of bio-MOF-11 evaluated?
data.answer: Through N2 adsorption experiments at 77 K.

data.question: Is the heat of adsorption for CO2 in bio-MOF-11 higher at the onset of adsorption compared to higher CO2 pressures?
What is the crystal system of bio-MOF-11?
What is the role of the Lewis basic amino and pyrimidine groups in bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: They contribute to the high heat of adsorption for CO2 due to favorable interactions with CO2 molecules.

data.question: Does bio-MOF-11 remain stable upon heating to 200 °C?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for CO2 at the onset of adsorption in bio-MOF-11?
What experimental technique was used to determine the crystal structure of bio-MOF-11?
Is the CO2 adsorption capacity of bio-MOF-11 at 298 K higher than its N2 adsorption capacity at the same temperature?
What is the significance of the paddle-wheel clusters in the structure of bio-MOF-11?
data.answer: They are used for constructing structurally rigid and permanently porous MOFs.

data.question: Does bio-MOF-11 exhibit a type-I isotherm for N2 adsorption at 77 K?
What is the crystallographic space group of bio-MOF-11?
How does the presence of narrow pore apertures in bio-MOF-11 contribute to its CO2 adsorption properties?
data.answer: The narrow pore apertures exclude gases with larger kinetic diameters, contributing to selective CO2 adsorption.
